channel.title: 6. Diffie Hellman on CryptoLearn
channel.description: Recent content in 6. Diffie Hellman on CryptoLearn

item.title: Introduction
item.description: The Diffie-Hellman key exchange is the method of safely developing and exchanging keys over an insecure channel. It allows two parties to establish a shared secret key over an unsecured communication channel. Unlike RSA, which is primarily used for encryption, Diffie-Hellman is focused on secure key exchange. Working: Let’s say, two parties, Alice and Bob agree on two large prime numbers, p and g, and a public key exchange algorithm.
